Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk gutenprint
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gutenprint bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated gutenprint packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The gutenprint packages contain drivers for Canon, Epson, Lexmark, Sony, Olympus, and PCL printers to be used in Linux, BSD, Solaris, IRIX, and other UNIX-like operating systems.
This update fixes the following bug:
* The name of the manual page for the ijsgutenprint.5.2 Ghostscript driver executable is ijsgutenprint(1). As a consequence, running the "man ijsgutenprint.5.2" command did not return any result, which could confuse some users. This update adds a stub ijsgutenprint.5.2(1) manual page that is automatically redirected to the ijsgutenprint(1) manual page in the described situation. (BZ#948967)
Users of gutenprint are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
